 DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN (MediaMetadataRetriever)

Detailed Description

MediaMetadataRetriever provides a unified interface for retrieving frame and meta data from an input media file.

The following example demostrates how to use the MediaMetadataRetriever

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState){
    //new a instance
    MediaMetadataRetriever* mmr = new MediaMetadataRetriever();

    //set a file path
    String *path = new String("/data/MM/music.mp3");
    mmr->setDataSource(path);

    //extract the artist name from music.mp3 metadata
    String *artist = mmr->extractMetadata(MediaMetadataRetriever::METADATA_KEY_ARTIST);

    //extract the year from music.mp3 metadata
    String *year = mmr->extractMetadata(MediaMetadataRetriever::METADATA_KEY_ARTIST);

 }

This example will try to extract metadata from a mp3 file, for example artist name, year, ...,etc.
you just need to do 3 steps as follows:
Step 1: new a MediaMetadataRetriever instance
Step 2: set a file path you want
Step 3: extract what info you want

Definition at line 66 of file MediaMetadataRetriever.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::media::MediaMetadataRetriever::MetadataKey

Seting metadata key can retrieve the media files information.

Enumerator:
METADATA_KEY_CD_TRACK_NUMBER 

The metadata key to retrieve the numberic string describing the order of the audio data source on its original recording.

METADATA_KEY_ALBUM 

The metadata key to retrieve the information about the album title of the data source.

METADATA_KEY_ARTIST 

The metadata key to retrieve the information about the artist of the data source.

METADATA_KEY_AUTHOR 

The metadata key to retrieve the information about the author of the data source.

METADATA_KEY_COMPOSER 

The metadata key to retrieve the information about the composer of the data source.

METADATA_KEY_DATE 

The metadata key to retrieve the date when the data source was created or modified.

METADATA_KEY_GENRE 

The metadata key to retrieve the content type or genre of the data source.

METADATA_KEY_TITLE 

The metadata key to retrieve the data source title.

METADATA_KEY_YEAR 

The metadata key to retrieve the year when the data source was created or modified.

METADATA_KEY_DURATION 

The metadata key to retrieve the playback duration of the data source.

METADATA_KEY_NUM_TRACKS 

The metadata key to retrieve the number of tracks, such as audio, video, text, in the data source, such as a mp4 or 3gpp file.

METADATA_KEY_WRITER 

The metadata key to retrieve the information of the writer (such as lyricist) of the data source.

METADATA_KEY_MIMETYPE 

The metadata key to retrieve the mime type of the data source.

Some example mime types include: "video/mp4", "audio/mp4", "audio/amr-wb", etc.

METADATA_KEY_ALBUMARTIST 

The metadata key to retrieve the information about the performers or artist associated with the data source.

METADATA_KEY_DISC_NUMBER 

The metadata key to retrieve the numberic string that describes which part of a set the audio data source comes from.

METADATA_KEY_COMPILATION 

The metadata key to retrieve the music album compilation status.

METADATA_KEY_HAS_AUDIO 

If this key exists the media contains audio content.

METADATA_KEY_HAS_VIDEO 

If this key exists the media contains video content.

METADATA_KEY_VIDEO_WIDTH 

If the media contains video, this key retrieves its width.

METADATA_KEY_VIDEO_HEIGHT 

If the media contains video, this key retrieves its height.

METADATA_KEY_BITRATE 

This key retrieves the average bitrate (in bits/sec), if available.

METADATA_KEY_TIMED_TEXT_LANGUAGES 

This key retrieves the language code of text tracks, if available.

If multiple text tracks present, the return value will look like: "eng:chi"

METADATA_KEY_IS_DRM 

If this key exists the media is drm-protected.

METADATA_KEY_LOCATION 

This key retrieves the location information, if available.

The location should be specified according to ISO-6709 standard, under a mp4/3gp box "@xyz". Location with longitude of -90 degrees and latitude of 180 degrees will be retrieved as "-90.0000+180.0000", for instance.

enum gaia::media::MediaMetadataRetriever::Option

See also:
getFrameAtTime(int64_t, int) to get a frame at a specified location.

Enumerator:
OPTION_PREVIOUS_SYNC 

This option is used with.

See also:
getFrameAtTime(int64_t, int) to retrieve a sync (or key) frame associated with a data source that is located right before or at the given time.
getFrameAtTime(int64_t, int)
OPTION_NEXT_SYNC 

This option is used with.

See also:
getFrameAtTime(int64_t, int) to retrieve a sync (or key) frame associated with a data source that is located right after or at the given time.
getFrameAtTime(int64_t, int)
OPTION_CLOSEST_SYNC 

This option is used with.

See also:
getFrameAtTime(int64_t, int) to retrieve a sync (or key) frame associated with a data source that is located closest to (in time) or at the given time.
getFrameAtTime(int64_t, int)
OPTION_CLOSEST 

This option is used with.

See also:
getFrameAtTime(int64_t, int) to retrieve a frame (not necessarily a key frame) associated with a data source that is located closest to or at the given time.
getFrameAtTime(int64_t, int)

Member Function Documentation

gaia::media::MediaMetadataRetriever::DISALLOW_COPY_AND_ASSIGN ( MediaMetadataRetriever  ) [private]
gaia::base::String gaia::media::MediaMetadataRetriever::extractMetadata ( MetadataKey  keyCode)

Call this method after setDataSource().

This method retrieves the meta data value associated with the keyCode.

The keyCode currently supported is listed below as METADATA_XXX constants. With any other value, it returns a null pointer.

Parameters:
keyCodeOne of the constants listed below at the end of the class.
Returns:
The meta data value associate with the given keyCode on success; null on failure.
gaia::base::ByteArray* gaia::media::MediaMetadataRetriever::getEmbeddedPictureN ( )

Call this method after setDataSource().

This method finds the optional graphic or album/cover art associated associated with the data source. If there are more than one pictures, (any) one of them is returned.

Returns:
null if no such graphic is found.
gaia::graphics::Bitmap* gaia::media::MediaMetadataRetriever::getFrameAtTimeN ( )

Call this method after setDataSource().

This method finds a representative frame at any time position if possible, and returns it as a bitmap. This is useful for generating a thumbnail for an input data source. Call this method if one does not care about where the frame is located; otherwise, please call

See also:
getFrameAtTime(int64_t) or
getFrameAtTime(int64_t, int)
Returns:
A Bitmap containing a representative video frame, which can be null, if such a frame cannot be retrieved.
See also:
getFrameAtTime(int64_t)
getFrameAtTime(int64_t, int)
gaia::graphics::Bitmap* gaia::media::MediaMetadataRetriever::getFrameAtTimeN ( const int64_t  timeUs)

Call this method after setDataSource().

This method finds a representative frame close to the given time position if possible, and returns it as a bitmap. This is useful for generating a thumbnail for an input data source. Call this method if one does not care how the frame is found as long as it is close to the given time; otherwise, please call

See also:
getFrameAtTime(int64_t, int).
Parameters:
timeUsThe time position where the frame will be retrieved. When retrieving the frame at the given time position, there is no guarentee that the data source has a frame located at the position. When this happens, a frame nearby will be returned. If timeUs is negative, time position and option will ignored, and any frame that the implementation considers as representative may be returned.
Returns:
A Bitmap containing a representative video frame, which can be null, if such a frame cannot be retrieved.
See also:
getFrameAtTime(int64_t, int)
gaia::graphics::Bitmap* gaia::media::MediaMetadataRetriever::getFrameAtTimeN ( int64_t  timeUs,
Option  option 
)

Call this method after setDataSource().

This method finds a representative frame close to the given time position by considering the given option if possible, and returns it as a bitmap. This is useful for generating a thumbnail for an input data source or just obtain and display a frame at the given time position.

Parameters:
timeUsThe time position where the frame will be retrieved. When retrieving the frame at the given time position, there is no guarantee that the data source has a frame located at the position. When this happens, a frame nearby will be returned. If timeUs is negative, time position and option will ignored, and any frame that the implementation considers as representative may be returned.
optiona hint on how the frame is found. Use
See also:
OPTION_PREVIOUS_SYNC if one wants to retrieve a sync frame that has a timestamp earlier than or the same as timeUs. Use
OPTION_NEXT_SYNC if one wants to retrieve a sync frame that has a timestamp later than or the same as timeUs. Use
OPTION_CLOSEST_SYNC if one wants to retrieve a sync frame that has a timestamp closest to or the same as timeUs. Use
OPTION_CLOSEST if one wants to retrieve a frame that may or may not be a sync frame but is closest to or the same as timeUs.
OPTION_CLOSEST often has larger performance overhead compared to the other options if there is no sync frame located at timeUs.
Returns:
A Bitmap containing a representative video frame, which can be null, if such a frame cannot be retrieved.
gaia::graphics::Bitmap* gaia::media::MediaMetadataRetriever::getFrameAtTimeN ( int64_t  timeUs,
Option  option,
int32_t  flag 
)

Add for get ARGB8888 thumbnail.

void gaia::media::MediaMetadataRetriever::setDataSource ( const gaia::storage::FileDescriptor &  fd,
int64_t  offset,
int64_t  length 
)

Sets the data source (FileDescriptor) to use.

It is the caller's responsibility to close the file descriptor. It is safe to do so as soon as this call returns. Call this method before the rest of the methods in this class. This method may be time-consuming.

Parameters:
fdthe FileDescriptor for the file you want to play
offsetthe offset into the file where the data to be played starts, in bytes. It must be non-negative
lengththe length in bytes of the data to be played. It must be non-negative.
Exceptions:
IllegalArgumentExceptionif the arguments are invalid
void gaia::media::MediaMetadataRetriever::setDataSource ( const gaia::base::String &  path)

Sets the data source (file pathname) to use.

Call this method before the rest of the methods in this class. This method may be time-consuming.

Parameters:
pathThe path of the input media file.
void gaia::media::MediaMetadataRetriever::setDataSource ( const gaia::core::Context &  context,
const gaia::net::Uri &  uri 
)

Sets the data source as a content Uri.

Call this method before the rest of the methods in this class. This method may be time-consuming.

Parameters:
contextthe Context to use when resolving the Uri
urithe Content URI of the data you want to play
Exceptions:
IllegalArgumentExceptionif the Uri is invalid
SecurityExceptionif the Uri cannot be used due to lack of permission.
